        The GLIMPSE3D Archive (GLM3DA or the âArchiveâ) consists of point sources with a signal- to-noise > 5 in at least one band and less stringent selection critera than the Catalog. The photometric uncertainty is typically < 0.3 mag. The GLIMPSE3D Catalog is a subset of the Archive, but note that the entries for a particular source might not be the same due to additional nulling of magnitudes in the Catalog because of the more stringent requirements.;Catalog

title:
GLIMPSE3D is the third in a series of large area projects to map selected regions of the Galactic plane using the Spitzer Space Telescope Infrared Array Camera (IRAC). GLIMPSEI1 covered the Galactic plane from |l| = 10â¦ to 65â¦ and |b| < 1â¦; GLIMPSEII filled in the inner 20 degrees of the Galactic plane, |l| < 10â¦, with vertical extensions up to Â±1.5â¦ for |l| =5â¦to 2â¦, and up to Â±2â¦ from |l| =2â¦to 0â¦. GLIMPSE3D adds vertical extensions, generally up to |b| < 3â¦, but up to |b| < 4.2â¦ in the center of the Galaxy. The goal of this coverage is to provide data to study the vertical stellar and interstellar

        The GLIMPSE3D Archive (GLM3DA or the âArchiveâ) consists of point sources with a signal- to-noise > 5 in at least one band and less stringent selection critera than the Catalog. The photometric uncertainty is typically < 0.3 mag. The GLIMPSE3D Catalog is a subset of the Archive, but note that the entries for a particular source might not be the same due to additional nulling of magnitudes in the Catalog because of the more stringent requirements.
